name: js/BaseTree.js
recursiveFind
description: Recursively find a particular object within a hierarchical dataset.

unknown.tagValue: {object|null} The first object matching the conditions.

params.name: hierarchicalObject
params.description: The initial hierarchical object to start the recursive find.

params.name: getChildren
params.description: The callback function that gets the children items of the hierarchical object.

params.name: findCondition
params.description: The callback function that defines whether the object matches the condition to be returned or not.

return.description: The first object matching the conditions.

name: recursiveGet
description: Recursively gets a set of objects within a hierarchical dataset.

params.name: hierarchicalObject
params.description: The initial hierarchical object to start the recursive get.

params.name: getChildren
params.description: The callback function that gets the children items of the hierarchical object.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.theme
params.description: The theme of the tree.

params.name: options.orientation
params.description: The orientation of the tree.

params.name: options.allowPan
params.description: Enables/disables the mouse drag to pan feature.

params.name: options.allowZoom
params.description: Enables/disables the mouse wheel to zoom feature.

params.name: options.allowFocus
params.description: If true, clicking on a node would focus to the node, hiding all irrelevant nodes that's not a parent, ancestor, or sibling.

params.name: options.allowNodeCentering
params.description: If true, clicking on a node would pan to the node.

params.name: options.minScale
params.description: Minimum zoom scaling.

params.name: options.maxScale
params.description: Maximum zoom scaling.

params.name: options.nodeDepthMultiplier
params.description: The distance between the parent and child nodes.

params.name: options.isFlatData
params.description: Indicates whether the passed data was a flat array of objects. If true, you must specify the `getParentId` option.

params.name: options.widthWithoutMargins
params.description: The width of the tree, not including the margins.

params.name: options.heightWithoutMargins
params.description: The height of the tree, not including the margins.

params.name: options.margins
params.description: Object specifying the margins of the tree diagram.

params.name: options.margins.top
params.description: The top margin for the tree diagram.

params.name: options.margins.right
params.description: The right margin for the tree diagram.

params.name: options.margins.bottom
params.description: The bottom margin for the tree diagram.

params.name: options.margins.left
params.description: The left margin for the tree diagram.

params.name: options.duration
params.description: Integer in milliseconds determining the duration of the animations for the tree.

params.name: options.loadOnDemandSettings
params.description: Object specifying the load-on-demand settings.

params.name: options.nodeSettings
params.description: Object specifying the node settings for the tree.

name: _nodeEnter
description:
Defines how to create the nodes for newly
added data objects.

params.name: nodeEnter
params.description: The D3 Enter selection of nodes.

name: _nodeUpdate
description:
Defines how to update the nodes for the
data objects.

params.name: nodeUpdate
params.description: The D3 Update selection of nodes.

params.name: nodeUpdateTransition
params.description: The D3 transition object for the D3 Update selection of nodes.

name: _nodeExit
description:
Defines how to remove the nodes for the
removed data objects.

params.name: nodeExit
params.description: The D3 Exit selection of nodes.

params.name: nodeExitTransition
params.description: The D3 transition object for the D3 Exit selection of nodes.

name: _getLinkPathGenerator
description:
Gets the path generator used to render
the links between the nodes.

unknown.tagValue: {function} The callback function that generates the SVG path coordinates for the links, given a coordinates object.

return.description: The callback function that generates the SVG path coordinates for the links, given a coordinates object.

name: _linkEnter
description:
Defines how to create the links for newly
added data objects.

params.name: source
params.description: The original data object that the links are being drawn for.

params.name: linkEnter
params.description: The D3 Enter selection of links.

name: _linkUpdate
description:
Defines how to update the links for the
data objects.

params.name: source
params.description: The original data object that the links are being drawn for.

params.name: linkUpdate
params.description: The D3 Update selection of links.

params.name: linkUpdateTransition
params.description: The D3 transition object for the D3 Update selection of links.

params.name: linkPathGenerator
params.description: The link path generator function.

name: _linkExit
description:
Defines how to remove the links for the
removed data objects.

params.name: source
params.description: The original data object that the links are being drawn for.

params.name: linkExit
params.description: The D3 Exit selection of links.

params.name: linkExitTransition
params.description: The D3 transition object for the D3 Update selection of links.

params.name: linkPathGenerator
params.description: The link path generator function.

name: _getNodeSize
description:
Called when updating dimensions when
node settings is configured to be
'nodesize'.

unknown.tagValue: {number[]} An array with two values, representing the height and width of the node respectively.

return.description: An array with two values, representing the height and width of the node respectively.

name: focusToNode
description: Focuses and expands all the way through to a node.

params.name: idOrNodeDataItem
params.description: The id of the node to focus, or the node data item object.

name: getIsFlatData
description:
Returns a boolean whether the
tree is using flat data or not.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether the tree is using flat data or not.

return.description: Whether the tree is using flat data or not.

name: setIsFlatData
description:
Sets the is flat data flag.
If set to true, you must specify
the `getParentId` option.

params.name: newIsFlatData
params.description: Whether the tree is using flat data or not.

name: regenerateNodeData
description: Regenerates the node data.

name: getTheme
description: Gets the tree theme.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The theme the tree is using.

return.description: The theme the tree is using.

name: setTheme
description: Sets the tree theme.

params.name: theme
params.description: The theme to set the tree to.

name: getOrientation
description: Gets the tree orientation.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The orientation the tree is using.

return.description: The orientation the tree is using.

name: setOrientation
description: Sets the tree orientation.

params.name: orientation
params.description: The orientation to set the tree to.

name: getData
description:
Gets the data items used to render
the nodes.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} The array of data items the tree uses.

return.description: The array of data items the tree uses.

name: setData
description:
Sets the data items the tree should
use to render the nodes.

params.name: newData
params.description: The new set of data items.

name: getNodeDepthMultiplier
description:
Gets the node depth multiplier that
affects the distance between the
parent node and the child node.

name: setNodeDepthMultiplier
description: Sets the node depth multiplier value.

params.name: newNodeDepthMultiplier
params.description: The value that affects the distance between the parent node and the child node.

name: getDuration
description:
Gets the duration of animations
for the tree.

name: setDuration
description:
Sets the duration of animations
for the tree.

params.name: newDuration
params.description: The animation duration in milliseconds.

name: getAllowPan
description:
Gets the boolean value indicating
whether the drag-to-pan pan feature
is enabled or not.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether panning is enabled or not.

return.description: Whether panning is enabled or not.

name: setAllowPan
description:
Sets the boolean value indicating
whether the drag-to-pan pan feature
is enabled or not.

params.name: newAllowPan
params.description: Whether panning is enabled or not.

name: getAllowZoom
description:
Gets the boolean value indicating
whether the mouse wheel to zoom in/out
feature is enabled or not.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether zooming is enabled or not.

return.description: Whether zooming is enabled or not.

name: setAllowZoom
description:
Sets the boolean value indicating
whether the mouse wheel to zoom in/out
feature is enabled or not.

params.name: newAllowZoom
params.description: Whether zooming is enabled or not.

name: getAllowFocus
description:
Gets the boolean value indicating
whether to focus to the clicked node
or not. Focusing on a node would hide
all irrelevant nodes that's not a 
parent, sibling or ancestor of the
clicked node.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether to focus to the clicked node.

return.description: Whether to focus to the clicked node.

name: setAllowFocus
description:
Sets the boolean value indicating
whether to focus to the clicked node
or not. Focusing on a node would hide
all irrelevant nodes that's not a 
parent, sibling or ancestor of the
clicked node.

params.name: newAllowFocus
params.description: Whether to pan to the clicked node.

name: getAllowNodeCentering
description:
Gets the boolean value indicating
whether to pan to a clicked node.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether to pan to the clicked node.

return.description: Whether to pan to the clicked node.

name: setAllowNodeCentering
description: Whether to pan to a clicked node.

params.name: newAllowNodeCentering
params.description: Whether to pan to the clicked node.

name: getMinScale
description: Gets the minimum zoom scaling.

name: setMinScale
description: Sets the minimum zoom scaling.

params.name: newMinScale
params.description: The minimum zoom scale value.

name: getMaxScale
description: Gets the maximum zoom scaling.

name: setMaxScale
description: Sets the maximum zoom scaling.

params.name: newMaxScale
params.description: The maximum zoom scale value.

name: getLoadOnDemandSettings
description: Gets the load on demand settings object.

name: getNodeSettings
description: Gets the node settings object.

name: getElement
description: Gets the container DOM element.

name: setElement
description: Sets the container DOM element

params.name: newElement
params.description: The container DOM element.

name: getRoot
description: Gets the root node object.

return.description: The root D3 tree node object.

name: getSvg
description: Gets the D3 selection object for the SVG element.

name: getView
description: Gets the D3 selection object for the view element.

unknown.tagValue: {object} D3 selection object for the view element.

return.description: D3 selection object for the view element.

name: getPanningContainer
description:
Gets the D3 selection object for the
panning container element.

unknown.tagValue: {object} D3 selection object for the panning container element.

return.description: D3 selection object for the panning container element.

name: getTreeGenerator
description:
Gets the D3 generator object used to
generate the tree nodes coordinates.

name: getNode
description: Get a single node given an id or a data item.

params.name: idOrDataItem
params.description: The ID or data item to retrieve the D3 tree node data item with.

name: getDataItem
description: Get a single data item given an id.

unknown.tagValue: {object} The data item with the given ID.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID to retrieve the data item with.

return.description: The data item with the given ID.

name: getNodes
description:
Get the array of D3 node data items
the D3 tree has generated.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} Array of D3 node data items.

return.description: Array of D3 node data items.

name: getVisibleNodes
description:
Get the array of visible D3 node
data items the D3 tree has generated.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} Array of D3 node data items.

return.description: Array of D3 node data items.

name: getLinks
description:
Get the array of D3 link data items
the D3 tree has generated.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} Array of D3 link data items.

return.description: Array of D3 link data items.

name: getZoomListener
description:
Gets the D3 zoom listener used for
the panning, zooming and focus features.

name: getId
description: Gets the ID for a given data item.

unknown.tagValue: {*} The ID for the given data item.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item to get the ID from.

return.description: The ID for the given data item.

name: getChildren
description: Gets the children data items for a given data item.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} The array of child data items.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item to get the children data items from.

return.description: The array of child data items.

name: getParentId
description: Gets the parent ID for a given data item.

unknown.tagValue: {*} The parent ID for the given data item.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item to get the parent ID from.

return.description: The parent ID for the given data item.

name: setIdAccessor
description:
Sets the ID accessor callback function,
defining how to get a unique ID from a
given data item.

params.name: newIdAccessor
params.description: Callback function to get the ID for a given data item.

name: setChildrenAccessor
description:
Sets the children accessor callback function,
defining how to get the children data items
from a given data item.

params.name: newChildrenAccessor
params.description: Callback function to get the children for a given data item.

name: setParentIdAccessor
description:
Sets the parent ID accessor callback function,
defining how to get the parent ID from a
given data item.

params.name: newParentIdAccessor
params.description: Callback function to get the parent id for a given data item.

name: getWidth
description: Gets the width of SVG, including the margins.

name: getHeight
description: Gets the height of SVG, including the margins.

name: setMargins
description: Sets the margins for the tree diagram.

params.name: newMargins
params.description: The margin object.

params.name: newMargins.top
params.description: The margin top for the tree diagram.

params.name: newMargins.right
params.description: The margin right for the tree diagram.

params.name: newMargins.bottom
params.description: The margin bottom for the tree diagram.

params.name: newMargins.left
params.description: The margin left for the tree diagram.

name: getMargins
description: Gets the margins for the tree diagram.

name: setWidthWithoutMargins
description: Sets the width of the SVG for the tree diagram.

params.name: newWidthWithoutMargin
params.description: The width of SVG for the tree diagram.

name: getWidthWithoutMargins
description:
Gets the width of the SVG for the tree diagram.
Does not include the margins.

unknown.tagValue: {number} The width (not including the margins) of the SVG for the tree diagram.

return.description: The width (not including the margins) of the SVG for the tree diagram.

name: setHeightWithoutMargins
description: Sets the height of the SVG for the tree diagram.

params.name: newHeightWithoutMargin
params.description: The height of SVG for the tree diagram.

name: getHeightWithoutMargins
description:
Gets the height of the SVG for the tree diagram.
Does not include the margins.

unknown.tagValue: {number} The height (not including the margins) of the SVG for the tree diagram.

return.description: The height (not including the margins) of the SVG for the tree diagram.

name: updateDimensions
description: Updates the dimensions of the SVG.

name: validateSettings
description:
Validates the settings to ensure the
tree diagram is ready to be generated.

name: initialize
description: Creates and set up the the tree diagram.

name: expand
description: Expands the given node data item.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to expand.

name: expandRecursively
description:
Expands the given node data item,
and its children and descendants.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to expand.

name: collapse
description: Collapses the given node data item.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to collapse.

name: collapseRecursively
description:
Collapses the given node data item,
and its children and descendants.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to collapse.

name: _populateUnderlyingChildren
description: Populates the node's children to a hidden property.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to collapse.

name: removeSelection
description: Remove node selections for a given node and it's children.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to remove selection from.

name: centerNode
description: Center the view to a D3 tree node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to focus on.

name: _onNodeDblClick
description:
Triggers the nodeDblClick event when a
D3 node is clicked on, and proceeds
to focus/expand/collapse the node.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True meaning it successfully focused/expanded/collapsed a node. False otherwise.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item that was clicked.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the D3 node being clicked in the array of siblings.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array of siblings D3 node, inclusive of the clicked node data item itself.

return.description: True meaning it successfully focused/expanded/collapsed a node. False otherwise.

name: _onNodeClick
description:
Triggers the nodeClick event when a
D3 node is clicked on, and proceeds
to focus/expand/collapse the node.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True meaning it successfully focused/expanded/collapsed a node. False otherwise.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item that was clicked.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the D3 node being clicked in the array of siblings.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array of siblings D3 node, inclusive of the clicked node data item itself.

return.description: True meaning it successfully focused/expanded/collapsed a node. False otherwise.

name: _createNode
description: Creates a child D3 tree node.

params.name: parentNodeDataItem
params.description: The parent D3 tree node data item.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item.

name: _addUnderlyingChildNode
description:
Creates and adds a child D3 tree
node to a given parent D3 tree node.

unknown.tagValue: {object} The newly created and added D3 node;

params.name: parentNodeDataItem
params.description: The parent D3 tree node data item.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item.

return.description: The newly created and added D3 node;

name: _processLoadedDataForNodeFocus
description:
Process the loaded data from AJAX
resulting from a node expand.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item being expanded.

params.name: result
params.description: The children data items to process.

name: nodeFocus
description: Focuses to a node, given a node data item.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The node being focused on.

name: _processLoadedDataForNodeToggle
description:
Process the loaded data from AJAX
resulting from a node toggle.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item.

params.name: result
params.description: Array of sibling node data items, inclusive the node being toggled.

name: nodeToggle
description: Toggles the children visibility for a given node data item.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: D3 Node data item.

name: hideSiblings
description:
Hide the siblings nodes
for a given node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node to hide siblings for.

name: updateTreeWithFocusOnNode
description:
Updates the tree diagram so only the relevant
focused node and direct parent hierarchies are
shown.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: D3 Node data item.

name: _updateNodes
description:
Updates the tree nodes given
a D3 tree node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to update.

params.name: nodes
params.description: Array of D3 node data items.

name: _updateLinks
description:
Updates the tree node links given
a D3 tree node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item.

params.name: links
params.description: Array of D3 link data items.

name: update
description: Updates the tree given a D3 tree node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item.

name: nodeClick
description:
Node click event, triggered when a
user clicks on a tree node.

properties.name: event.type
properties.description: The type of the operation the click will trigger, whether it's 'focus', 'expand', or 'collapse'.

properties.name: event.continue
properties.description: Whether to continue the node focusing/expanding/collapsing.

properties.name: event.preventDefault
properties.description: Call this function to prevent the default behavior of node focusing/expanding/collapsing.

properties.name: event.nodeDataItem
properties.description: Node data item representing the clicked node.

properties.name: event.nodeDataItem.data
properties.description: The data item of the clicked node.

properties.name: event.nodeDataItemIndex
properties.description: Index of the clicked item in the array of siblings.

properties.name: event.nodeDataItems
properties.description: The array of sibling rendered SVG elements, inclusive of the node itself.

name: js/BoxedTree.js

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.getBodyDisplayText
params.description: Determines how to obtain the body text to display for a node corresponding to a data item.

params.name: options.getTitleDisplayText
params.description: Determines how to obtain the title text to display for a node corresponding to a data item.

name: setBodyDisplayTextAccessor
description:
Sets the body display text accessor,
used to get the body display text
for the nodes.

name: getBodyDisplayText
description: Gets the body display text for a given data item.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The body display text to render for the node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The data item to get the body display text from.

return.description: The body display text to render for the node.

name: setTitleDisplayTextAccessor
description:
Sets the title display text accessor,
used to get the title display text
for the nodes.

name: getTitleDisplayText
description: Gets the title display text for a given data item.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The title display text to render for the node.

params.name: nodeDataItem
params.description: The D3 node data item to get the title display text from.

return.description: The title display text to render for the node.

params.name: options

params.name: options.getDisplayText

Sets the display text accessor,
used to get the display text
for the nodes.

name: js/CustomD3.js
js/LoadOnDemandSettings.js

params.name: ownerObject
params.description: The owner object.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.hasChildren
params.description: Sets the hasChildren callback function, used to determine whether a node or data item has children or not.

params.name: options.loadChildren
params.description: the loadChildren callback function, used to load children data items for a node.

name: back
description: Gets the owner object.

name: validateSettings
description:
Validates whether the provided
settings are correct or not.

name: loadChildren
description: Load the children for a given data object.

params.name: data
params.description: The data item, which should be used to load the children of the data item via AJAX.

params.name: processData
params.description: Callback function to process the children data items.

name: hasChildren
description:
Returns a boolean indicating whether
the passed data item has children.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether the data item has children or not.

params.name: dataItem
params.description: The data item to check if it has children or not.

return.description: Whether the data item has children or not.

name: setLoadChildrenMethod
description:
Sets the loadChildren callback function,
used to load children data items for
a node.

name: setHasChildrenMethod
description:
Sets the hasChildren callback function,
used to determine whether a node
or data item has children or not.

name: isEnabled
description:
Returns a boolean indicating whether
load-on-demand is enabled or not.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether load-on-demand is enabled or not.

return.description: Whether load-on-demand is enabled or not.

name: js/NodeSettings.js

params.name: ownerObject
params.description: The owner object

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the node settings.

params.name: options.sizingMode
params.description: The sizing mode. Should be either 'nodeSize' to automatically size the SVG based on the nodes, or 'size' to use the configured width and height.

params.name: options.horizontalSpacing
params.description: The horizontal spacing value.

params.name: options.verticalSpacing
params.description: The vertical spacing value.

name: back
description: Gets the owner object.

name: getHorizontalSpacing
description: Gets the horizontal spacing value.

name: setHorizontalSpacing
description: Sets the horizontal spacing value.

params.name: newHorizontalSpacing
params.description: The new horizontal spacing value.

name: getVerticalSpacing
description: Gets the vertical spacing value.

name: setVerticalSpacing
description: Sets the vertical spacing value.

params.name: newVerticalSpacing
params.description: The new vertical spacing value.

name: getSizingMode
description: Gets the sizing mode.

name: setSizingMode
description: Sets the sizing mode.

params.name: newSizingMode
params.description: The sizing mode. Should be either 'nodeSize' to automatically size the SVG based on the nodes, or 'size' to use the configured width and height.

[![Netlify Status](https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/badges/caf9565a-9cd5-47c2-a6d8-e52333d17376/deploy-status)](https://app.netlify.com/sites/mitch-datasource/deploys)
[![Dependabot Enabled](https://img.shields.io/badge/Dependabot-Enabled-lightgrey.svg?logo=dependabot&labelColor=blue)](https://dependabot.com/)

![D3 MitchTree Demo](manual/asset/D3MitchTree Demo.gif)

# Introduction

A D3 plugin which lets you create a stunning interactive hierarchical tree visualisation with a flat/nested dataset. It has various features which makes it suitable for traversing large data sets.

# Features

* Zoom and Panning
* Automatically pan to the clicked node
* Hide irrelevant nodes while traversing the tree
* Supports AJAX load-on-demand
* Supports theming (via CSS)

# Documentation

The project documentation can be found in the repo's [Netlify site](https://d3-mitch-tree.netlify.com)

# License

MIT © Michael Tran

content:
{
  "name": "d3-mitch-tree",
  "version": "0.0.0-development",
  "description": "D3 plugin to create interactive navigatable hierarchical tree diagrams.",
  "main": "./lib/d3-mitch-tree.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build-dev": "npm-run-all \"build-sass\" \"build-webpack-dev\" \"build-docs\"",
    "build-prd": "npm-run-all \"build-sass\" \"build-webpack-prd\" \"build-docs\"",
    "watch": "npm-run-all --parallel \"watch-sass\" \"watch-webpack\" \"watch-docs\"",
    "build-sass": "node ./build/build-sass.js",
    "watch-sass": "nodemon --watch ./src/sass --ext * --exec \"npm run build-sass\"",
    "build-webpack-dev": "webpack --config webpack.config.js --mode=development",
    "build-webpack-prd": "webpack --config webpack.config.js --mode=production",
    "watch-webpack": "npm run build-webpack-dev -- --watch",
    "build-docs": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "watch-docs": "nodemon --watch ./src/js --watch ./manual --watch ./README.md --ext * --exec \"npm run build-docs\"",
    "commit": "npx git-cz"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "d3",
    "d3-module",
    "javascript"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/javy1103/d3-mitch-tree.git"
  },
  "author": "Michael Tran <MTran0011@outlook.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/javy1103/d3-mitch-tree/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://d3-mitch-tree.netlify.com",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.7.4",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.7.4",
    "@commitlint/cli": "^8.2.0",
    "@commitlint/config-conventional": "^8.2.0",
    "@semantic-release/changelog": "^5.0.1",
    "@semantic-release/git": "^9.0.0",
    "autoprefixer": "^9.7.3",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.6",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-publish-markdown-plugin": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "husky": "^4.0.1",
    "mkdirp": "^1.0.4",
    "node-sass": "^4.13.0",
    "nodemon": "^2.0.1",
    "npm-run-all": "^4.1.5",
    "postcss": "^7.0.24",
    "webpack": "^4.41.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.10"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "d3-hierarchy": "^1.1.9",
    "d3-selection": "^1.4.1",
    "d3-shape": "^1.3.7",
    "d3-zoom": "^1.8.3",
    "d3plus-text": "^0.9.50"
  },
  "husky": {
    "hooks": {
      "commit-msg": "commitlint -E HUSKY_GIT_PARAMS"
    }
  }
}

# Introduction

A D3 plugin which lets you create a stunning interactive hierarchical tree visualisation with a flat/nested dataset. It has various features which makes it suitable for traversing large data sets.

# Features

* Zoom and Panning
* Automatically pan to the clicked node
* Hide irrelevant nodes while traversing the tree
* Supports AJAX load-on-demand
* Supports theming (via CSS)

# Examples

HTML examples are included as part of the project as within the `examples` folder. Simply clone or download the repository and open up those files with your browser to see D3MitchTree in action.

# License

MIT © Michael Tran
name: ./manual/index.md
./manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

## With Browser

Note that you don't actually need `D3` itself to start using this library. You can use this library with or without `D3`.

### Local Files

1. Clone or download this git repository, and move the contents of the `dist` folder to your project. For example, you can put it in `/scripts/d3-mitch-tree` inside your project.

2. Import the D3MitchTree files as below, changing the path depending on where you copied it into for your project
   ```html
   <script src="/scripts/d3-mitch-tree/js/d3-mitch-tree.min.js"></script>
   <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/scripts/d3-mitch-tree/css/d3-mitch-tree.min.css">
   <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/scripts/d3-mitch-tree/css/d3-mitch-tree-default.min.css">
   ```

### CDN

You can alternatively use CDN so you don't have to download and set up the files:
```html
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/javy1103/d3-mitch-tree@1.0.2/dist/js/d3-mitch-tree.min.js"></script>
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/javy1103/d3-mitch-tree@1.0.2/dist/css/d3-mitch-tree.min.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/javy1103/d3-mitch-tree@1.0.2/dist/css/d3-mitch-tree-default.min.css">
```

## With NPM

D3MitchTree is available on npm. You can perform the following steps to get it set up.

1. Open up your terminal, and run the below command from your project directory:
   ```bash
   npm install d3-mitch-tree --save
   ```

2. Now you can use CommonJS, AMD, or ES6 to import the plugin. For example:
   ```JavaScript
   var mitchTree = require('d3-mitch-tree');
   ```

name: ./manual/usage.md
./manual/api.md
./manual/development.md
content:
# Development

## Major Dependencies
* [D3.js](https://d3js.org/) 5.0.0+
  * Used to build the main bulk of the visualisation
* [D3Plus Textbox](https://github.com/d3plus/d3plus-text) 0.9.0+
  * Truncates text to fit to a node
  * Vertical alignment of texts
  * Title tooltips on hover

Note these dependencies does not need to be imported by the user in the front end. This is only needed when building the project, or when using module loaders such as `CommonJS`, `AMD`, etc.

## Technologies Used

This package was created using:
* `webpack` as the bundler
* `npm` scripts to run common tasks (e.g. build and sass compilation), instead of gulp, grunt
* `babel` with webpack to transpile JavaScript from ES6 to ES5, so this package codebase can utilise the newest ES6 features
* `esdoc` to build the API documentations.

## Available NPM Commands
- `npm run build-docs` - Build the HTML documentations using ESDoc.
- `npm run build-dev` - Build code with development settings.
- `npm run build-prd` - Build code with production settings.
- `npm run watch` - Build code and docs with development settings anytime when a change has been detected.
